hook.text: A woman can only conceive during about six days of each menstrual cycle. Timing is everything.

buildup.text: The fertile window includes the five days before ovulation and the day of ovulation itself.

discovery.text: Sperm can survive up to five days inside the female body, waiting for the egg to be released.

twist.text: The egg only survives 12 to 24 hours after ovulation. Miss that window and conception cannot occur.

climax.text: Understanding the fertile window is essential for both achieving and preventing pregnancy naturally.

punchline.text: Six days a month. Precision matters.

quiz.question: How long can sperm survive inside the female body?
